title: Artificial Intelligence in Diagnosing Medical Conditions and Impact on Healthcare
author: MGMA
content: AI analyzes medical data using subdomains such as machine learning (ML) and natural language processing (NLP), transforming diagnosis and treatment. Accurate and timely medical diagnosis is crucial for early detection and better treatment outcomes, and using AI to assist provides numerous benefits, including faster and more precise diagnoses, early disease detection and personalized treatments. It also automates routine tasks, easing the workload for healthcare professionals and detects subtle patterns in medical data that humans might miss.

title: Artificial Intelligence for Medical Diagnosticsâ€”Existing and Future AI
author: NCBI
content: AI algorithms can analyze medical images (e.g., X-rays, MRIs, ultrasounds, CT scans, and DXAs) and assist healthcare providers in identifying and diagnosing diseases more accurately and quickly. AI can analyze large amounts of patient data, including medical 2D/3D imaging, bio-signals (e.g., ECG, EEG, EMG, and EHR), vital signs (e.g., body temperature, pulse rate, respiration rate, and blood pressure), demographic information, medical history, and laboratory test results.

title: AI's Transformative Power In Healthcare Diagnostics
author: Forbes
content: The rapid adoption of AI is transforming and reshaping everything from disease detection to the creation of personalized treatment plans and the monitoring of intervention effectiveness and health metrics. Often, the subset of AI leveraged for healthcare diagnostics is machine learning (ML). ML's significance in healthcare diagnostics comes from its ability to learn from big data, identify patterns, make predictions, and provide actionable insights.

title: Revolutionizing healthcare: the role of artificial intelligence in clinical diagnosis
author: BMC Medical Education
content: Integrating AI into healthcare holds excellent potential for improving disease diagnosis, treatment selection, and clinical laboratory testing. AI can revolutionize different aspects of health care, including diagnosis. ML is an area of AI that uses data as an input resource in which the accuracy is highly dependent on the quantity as well as the quality of the input data that can combat some of the challenges and complexity of diagnosis.

title: Opinion: It's not just hype. AI could revolutionize diagnosis in medicine
author: Los Angeles Times
content: AI can, in fact, diagnose disease using new patterns too subtle for humans to identify. Consider, for example, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, a condition where AI can detect subtle patterns imperceptible to human observers. AI mitigates common factors contributing to diagnostic errors such as fatigue, time constraints, cognitive limitations, knowledge gaps, and reliance on mental shortcuts that can affect human practitioners.

title: AI and professional liability assessment in healthcare. A revolution ...
author: Frontiers in Medicine
content: The adoption of advanced artificial intelligence (AI) systems in healthcare is transforming the healthcare-delivery landscape. Artificial intelligence may enhance patient safety and improve healthcare outcomes, but it presents notable ethical and legal dilemmas. Moreover, as AI streamlines the analysis of the multitude of factors relevant to malpractice claims, including informed consent, adherence to standards of care, and causation, the evaluation of professional liability might also benefit from its use.

title: Who pays when AI steers your doctor wrong?
author: POLITICO
content: The integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in the medical field has reignited discussions surrounding reforms in medical malpractice, but with a unique perspective. Physicians leveraging novel AI tools to aid in diagnosing and treating patients are seeking clarity on a crucial issue: accountability in case AI errors occur.

title: Civil liability for the actions of autonomous AI in healthcare
author: Nature
content: The use of AI-enabled medical robots in healthcare settings poses a host of legal and ethical questions, especially regarding the attribution of liability for the injuries and deaths caused by such AI-driven devices.

title: Liability for Use of Artificial Intelligence in Medicine
author: University of Michigan Law School Scholarship Repository
content: Questions of liability for AI-related injury raise not only immediate concerns for potentially liable parties, but also broader systemic questions about how AI will be developed and adopted.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Liability in Medicine: Balancing Safety and ...
author: National Center for Biotechnology Information
content: With increasing integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning in medicine, there are concerns that algorithm inaccuracy could lead to patient injury and medical liability.
